gurmukhi: sXwm so mweI khw khIXY ieh swQ krY ihqvw br jorI ]Byjq hY hm ko ieh pY ieh sI iqhky pih gÍwrn QorI ]721]
transliteration: Syaam So Maaikahaa Kaheeyai Eh Saath Darai Hitvaa Bar Joree|| Bhejat Hai Ham Ko Eh Pai Eh Sitihke Pah(i) Gvaaran Thoree||721||
translation: “O my mother, what should I say? Krishna is forcibly exhibiting his love for her and is sending us to her; is Krishna short of gopis like her?721.

gurmukhi: Byjq hY ieh pY hmkoN ieh gÍwrin rUp ko mwn krY ]ieh jwnq vY Gt hY hm qy iqhqy hT bwND rhI n trY ]
transliteration: Bhejat Hai Eh Pai Hamkon Eh Gvaaran(i) Roop Ko Maan Darai|| Eh Jaanat Vai Ghat Hai Ham Te Tihte Hath Baandh Rahina Darai||
translation: “He sends us to her and she is egoistic about her beauty; she also knows that all other gopis do not equal her in beauty, therefore she is persistent in her attitude;”

gurmukhi: kib sXwm ipKo ieh gÍwrin kI mq sXwm ky kop qy pY n frY ]iqh so bil jwau khw khIXY iqh lXwvhu XoN muK qy aucrY ]722]
transliteration: Kah(i) Syaam Pikho Eh Gvaaran(i) Kimat Syaam Ke Kop Te Pai Na Darai|| Tih So Bal(i) Jaau Kahaa Kahiyai Tih Layaavoh Yon Moukh Te Ouchrai||722||
translation: The poet Shyam says that this gopi (Radha) does not fear even slightly from Krishna, he is a sacrifice on her boldness when she says that Krishna be brought before her.722.

gurmukhi: sXwm krY sKI Aaur so pRIq qby ieh gÍwrin BUl pCwnY ]vwky kIey ibn rI sjnI su rhI kih kY su kihXo nhI mwnY ]
transliteration: Syaam Darai Sakhiaur Preet Tabe Eh Gvaaran(i) Bhool Pachhaadai|| Vaake Keee Bin Risajnisu Rahikah(i) Kai Su Kahiyo Nahimaanai||
translation: “Krishna loves someone else, this gopi has no comprehension about it; without any words from him, she continues to say this and is not submitting to his wishes;

gurmukhi: Xwko ibswr fry mn qy qbhI ieh mwnih ko Pl jwnY ]AMq iKswie GnI Akulwie kihXo qb hI ieh mwnY qu mwnY ]723]
transliteration: Yaako Bisaar Dare Man Te Tab-hieh Maanah(i) Ko Phal Jaanai|| Ant Khisaae Ghaniakulaae Kahiyo Tab Hieh Maanai Tu Maanai||723||
translation: “When Krishna will forget her, then she will know the reward of such persistence and in the end, feeling embarrassed, she will conciliate him; at that time, nothing can be said, whether he will accede to her request or not.”723.

gurmukhi: XO sun ky biRKBwn suqw iqh gÍwrin ko iem au`qr dIno ]pRIq krI hir cMdRBgw sMg qau hmhUM Apmwn su kIno ]
transliteration: You Soun Kai Brikhbhaan Soutaa Tih Gvaaran(i) Ko Im Outtar Deeno|| Dareet Karihar(i) Channdrabhagad San Tau Hamhoon Apmaan Su Keeno||
translation: Hearing this, Radha replied to her, “Krishna is absorbed in love with Chandarbhaga, therefore, I have shown my disrespect for him;

gurmukhi: qau sjnI kihXo rUT rhI Aiq kRoD biFXo hmry jb jI no ]qory khy ibnrI hir Awgy hUM mohU so nyhu ibdw kr dIno ]724]
transliteration: Tau Sajnikahiyo Rooth Rahiat(i) Krodh Badhiyo Hamre Jab Jino|| Tore Kahe Binrihar(i) Aage Hoon Mohoo So Neh(u) Bidaa Kar Deeno||724||
translation: “On this, you have said so much, therefore my anger increased; on your request, I loved Krishna an now he has abandoned his love with me.”724.

gurmukhi: XO kih gÍwrin so bqIXw kib sXwm khY iPr AYsy kihXo hY ]jwih rI kwhy ko bYTI hY gÍwrin qyro khXo Aiq hI mY sihXo hY ]
transliteration: You Kah(i) Gvaaran(i) So Bateeyaa Kabi Syaam Kahai Phir Aise Kahiyo Hai|| Jaah(i) Rikaahe Ko Baithihai Gvaaran(i) Tero Kahyo At(i) Himai Sahiyo Hai||
translation: Saying thus to the gopi, Radha added, “O gopi! you may go, I have endured your words very much;

gurmukhi: bwq khI Aiq hI rs kI quih qwko n so sKI ic`q cihXo hY ]qwhI qy hau n clo sjnI hm sO hir sO rs kaun rihXo hY ]725]
transliteration: Baat Kahiat(i) Hiras Kituh(i) Taako Na So Sakhichitt Chahiyo Hai|| Taahite Hau Na Chalo Sajniham Sau Har(i) Sau Ras Kaoun Rahiyo Hai||725||
translation: “You have talked many things about the love-passion and pleasure, which I did not like in my mind; O friend ! I therefore, shall not go to Krishna, because there is no love left now between me and Krishna.”725.

gurmukhi: XO sun au`qr dyq BeI kib sXwm khY hir ky ihq kyro ]kwnH ky Byjy qy Xw pih AwiekY kY kY mnwvn ko Aiq Jyro ]
transliteration: Yaoun Soun Outtar Det Bhaikabi Syaam Kahai Har(i) Ke Hit Kero|| Kaahn Ke Bheje Te Yaa Pah(i) Aae-kai Kai Manaavan Ko At(i) Jhero||
translation: Hearing this reply of Radha, the gopi said, talking in the interest of Krishna, “It is a very great botheration to come repeatedly and persuade her at the bidding of Krishna;

gurmukhi: sXwm ckor mno qRn jo sun rI ieh BwNq khY mn myro ]qwhI inhwr inhwr suno sis so muK dyKq hÍY hY rI qyro ]726]
transliteration: Syaam Chakor Mano Tran Jo Soun Rieh Bhaant Kahai Man Mero|| Tahinihaar Nihaar Souno Sas(i) So Moukh Dekhat Hvai Hai Ritero||726||
translation: “O Radha ! my mind says that Krishna like a partridge is anxious to see your face like moon.”726.
